content: Nice and relaxing Japanese mahjong app with easy access to rules and combinations for newcomers!
Works great, desktop app is nice too.
A perfect, relaxing app for mahjong with some cute characters.

userName: It's OK to change your mind about things
content: This has just become my new number one mahjong game. I had recently bought Mahjong Nagomi on Steam and it's lacking just about every bit of stylism and Quality of Life that Kemono Mahjong delivers. I'll be retiring Nagomi and playing Kemono full time! I like the voice acting and character descriptions to help with roleplaying, and the fact i can have three of the same characters playing with me.
useful examples for learning
The ai is quite weak but the game is good.
Great game with fun Bot gameplay!
as a beginner I find it good to play, watch your battery level cstefully
Overall very well done with having different AI personalities and giving a fun way for solo and online play.

Highly addictive and time worthy. Once you go over the tutorial twice or maybe even three times, the game consumes you like an elephant stepping into quick sand. I highly recommend this game to anybody who love their leisure time.
Why am I in Furiten if I called for Riichi? Edit: Thanks for the lesson
replyContent: Hi there; thanks for playing. You can be furiten and riichi at the same time. (If you've discarded a tile that you could use to win on, you're furiten, but that doesn't prevent you from declaring riichi). You can still win on a draw from the wall. Hope that helps.

content: Very good app to learn and play. Well worth the price.
Awesome, but I wish I could see the other players tiles after each round, so I could maybe learn.

I went from barely understanding Furiten to ending a game in 3 turns because Farley dealt into a honitsu and full straight twice in a row. Fantastic game, wonderful presentation, incredibly helpful tutorial including hand lookups midmatch and tooltips at the results screen. I can't imagine I'd have stuck with mahjong without this game.
A fun game that well teacher you about how to play and well worth the asking price.
A cute mahjong game with great tutorials and accessibility features
One of the best app I purchase ever in my life

Incredible app, the best starting point for learning riichi. The numbered tiles, English yaku, forgiving ai, and other QoL features turn a complex game into an inviting experience. If I could add/change anything : -allow red 5s in single player -more robust online, with lobbies and rankings -alternate views to properly simulate how the game is played at a table (this might not work well on phones) -ability to turn off "highlighted tiles"
replyContent:
Thank you for the kind words and suggestions. (NB: Red 5s can be enabled in single player mode via the Settings, & "table view" is available on medium-large size tablets... but I felt the vertical format worked best on phones' narrow screens) :)
Extra online modes are tricky without a (very) large player base, but are planned.
Thanks again. :)

content: really enjoying it! I'm new to mahjong, so having the tutorials and the easy to access guides is really helpful! the character designs are cute, and I like that you can customize who you play against and that everyone has a different play style. highly recommend to anyone just getting in to mahjong or wanting something to do in between their in-person games!!
The app has done a wonder job of teaching me the rules to riichi mahjong. It's addictive and the voice acting is a nice touch.
Would be better if it had table graphics, but it's very good already.
It's just... really hard to win... I never get what I want 😂
Great! Good tutorials and an easy yaku reference. The scoring is also very well explained. I like that there is the option to see the Japanese names for winning hands.

I'd be lying if I said I've tried other Mahjong apps, but after getting hooked on Mahjong thanks to Yakuza 0, this app is pretty much the same experience. Very well made, has learning resources built in as well as a hand guide you can access mid game And you can pretty easily play it one handed, which isn't something I would think to look for in phone games but I'm surprised how much I appreciate it here and I mean, you get to play Mahjong with cute furries, 10/10
Fun game, good tutorials.

Great game. A wonderful adaptation of the EMA Richii Mahjong rules. It's a beautiful game that I look forward to trying to understand better for years to come. The controls are great. Maybe a little fiddly due to the size of the tiles. I'm really enjoying the game, though.
Great way to learn a very complicated game.
All of the options a close together. Great educational value for mahjong though.

Love the interface, and the AI difficulty seems just right. Learning as I go along is less intimidating than in other mahjong games because of the helpful tutorials and tooltips, they really are appreciated!
Awesome Japanese Mahjong game. The art is awesome and the controls were well built.
Love the game and it's beautifully designed.
replyContent: Thank you so much!

content: This app made me love mahjong even more and also turned me into a furry.

Definitely worth the purchase thank you for this awesome app! I had no idea how to play yesterday and I'm totally getting it now, winning rounds on a decent basis. I cant wait to play with my aunties 🤩😝
replyContent: Thank you for playing, I'm glad the app has been helpful for learning. :) (Good luck against your aunties!)

content: Bestt Riichi Mahjong game on Android. Made by a furry. This is the price we pay to approach godliness.
Excellent mahjong experience. Could do with a matchmaking system
The game is very good, but the only complain I have is that you can't slide the tile you want to discard. Instead you need to click the discard button. It's a small thing, but I prefer it
I've never played mahjong before and this is a really nice entry point!! Love the character designs too!! 😻

A very fun and well designed game, with great art and mechanics. The tutorials are very helpful, and its the best riichi style mahjong app on the appstore. The only criticism I have is that for a new user, not knowing what u need or want in your hand is hard. I would love an update that either added a "What am I missing in my hand" or "Han total right now" option. Even a beginner mode that gives hints or options of what to discard would also be helpful. Otherwise, amazing game and worth it!
Super cute character design, and a really good way to learn how to play the game! Do you have any other games in production?
replyContent:
Thank you, 'glad you enjoy. :)
(No other games yet - most of my spare time has been focused on this one. But I have a few ideas I'll maybe get to one day. :)  )

content: Fantastic for learning Japanese mahjong. Which as a longtime player of the Tianjin and Shanghai variants, is very foreign to me. But I love it and I love the animal people characters and the really concise UI. Edit: actually I do have a suggestion. You ought to add a tutorial for "mahjong strategy 101," and talk about the basics of defensive play.
replyContent: Thank you, glad you enjoy. Japanese style is a bit tricky, yes. If something is particularly confusing, ask me on Twitter or via email and I'll try to help. :)

content: great game, but pieces are tiny
Great majong game, rules and instructions very clear and easy to use, very realistic

Linear format needs a bit to get used to, would be nice to see a traditional square mahjong table layout while playing. Also would be nice to have other style of mahjong (Taiwan, Hong Kong, China, Singapore) to play. Otherwise, great app that is able to fill short amount of time.
The game is fun and basicily sound , i'm used to the old rules of japanese mahjong as I've played it, a very long time . So I don't like the excessive furitans, that they have in this game.
Everything you really want from a Mahjong game with good production
I love it. It scratches the itch I've been having since learning how to play from the Yakuza game series.
Excellent Riichi Mahjong game. Bought it to learn to play in Yakuza game. Tutorials were spot on.

Probably the best mahjong app for beginners. Good ui, settings, post-hand score breakdown, and a variety of cpu types to play against. Saves progress when you close the app in single player mode as well.

While I generally like the app, I am not a fan of this new faux-3D look on the tiles. It effectively gives an unattractive look due to the long horizontal line, the odd look above the line, and the general squashed look of the tile. While there are a number of tile options, there is not a setting back to a flat look.
I really like this game and the characters. For people just getting into the game, it's a nice way to start learning.
replyContent: Hello, glad you enjoy the game. I should have included some female characters initially, yes. There are a bunch in development now, though. :)

content: these enforced new tile graphics and backgrounds genuinely make me want to never play this again, to be brutally honest. the furry insert was already bad, and the last update was the final nail in the coffin. yeah, most of the mahjong mechanics are overall smooth (albeit a bit slow) and i far preferred this app over others despite its flaws for a while. you do some things really well, while others not so much. the online multiplayer implementation is riddled with bugs, also.
replyContent: v1.09.61 brings back a "classic" tile set option. Sorry you don't like the crisper backgrounds. I'll see what I can do to address your other concerns.

content: i think the ai is weak, but if you're looking for furry mahjong this is it. now if only there were an ero furry bara strip mahjong game...

Overall, this is pretty solid. The anthropomorphized animal characters are a bit weird, but I can get past that. The gameplay is strong, music is nice, and UI is pretty good. In the most recent update, everything got a bit slower in pace. The best example of this is that the amount of time before computer characters discard tiles when it becomes their turn has increased a bit. It makes the rounds feel a bit more tedious. Regardless, it's a nice mahjong game.
Works great! I think it would be cool if there could be animations and voice lines for my own calls, not just the opponent calls.

Great way to play and learn most types of Asian mahjong. I believe you can play most variants, Chinese, Japanese, etc by customizing rules. I've played a lot of this app, and I will continue as long as the game still runs.
Thanks to this app, I'm finally able to understand mahjong lol.I used to think the discard area was how I built my hand ;-; But aghh noones online in the us >-< i wish more people played this app!

I love playing this game so much! The voice acting and art style is amazing ♥ It did take some time to learn what I was doing and how to actually win, but once I replay the tutorials and started playing more and more, it easy was to catch on. Definetly a great price for a great game 👍
UI could be better, but still the best Riichi Mahjong app with options for offline solo play/practice
Legit Mahjong with great artwork and easy to understand UI!
Would like a more streamlined way to play online with others as it just has you create a table and wait. But this is great for learning and getting a feel for it.

Great Japanese mahjong game. Unique and attractive visuals. Would like to see the inclusion of akadora. Hope to see more updates in the near future! EDIT: The updates to this game just keep coming! Jusy revisited this, and I akadora, and online play even? Keep up the great work :)
Very well made game, very informative on how the game works, and is easy to learn if you take the time.

It's mahjong, with cute animals. What's not to like? Well implemented rules, great definitions and if you're new to the game, A TON of great learning content. I got it for free at a mahjong event but I'd absolutely pay for it.
Excellent Riichi Mahjong app with great teaching material and fur bait. You can tell a lot of love was put into it.

Absolutely love this game, helped me discover and learn how to play riichi mahjong. Tutorials are simple and easy to follow along, the illustrations are nice to look at and it runs pretty well. And now with an online mode, I can finally play with my friends when we can't and play others without feeling lost or falling (too) far behind. Great game if you are looking to learn and play with others.
replyContent: Thank you so much! :)

content: Well made and instructional
Awsome game, Awsome art.

It's very difficult to find a Riichi mahjong game and this one nails it. Yes,it's furry mahjong,but the game follows the rules well and is a great learning tool since you can't screw up a move, the game won't let you.if you are a beginner, there is some learning still needed, but with time, practice, and a lot of googling, you will learn the game. I highly recommend this game, it's done very well. If only it had custom online games,I would be set, but it is only single player.

This game has been an excellent way to learn Riichi Mahjong, plus it's not bloated with ads and pay to play mechanics. It's a great tactical game that can easily burn an afternoon away. The tutorials are excellent to start, but it's difficult to master! If you're willing to put in the work though this game is addictive, strategic, and fun!
Great actual mahjong game
Great way to learn riichi mahjong.

Great app for beginners. Love how the scoring screen breaks down Fu calculation and allows you to look up yaku. BUT after playing around with it a bit, turns out I really don't like the "four bars" layout. Please consider adding a more classical look to the table, where the players sit in a circle and discard into the middle (e.g. compare Tenhou).
It's the best real Mahjong app on the store, which is why it's unfortunate that all the characters are furries.
Great way to practice playing Riichi Mahjong, with cute characters to boot.
Great game and great tutorials. Don't let the furry look deceive you, this is THE mahjong game for Android.
I enjoy swearing at the adorable animals when I lose.
Nice app! Any plans to implement 赤ドラ??
replyContent:
Thanks, glad you like it.
Red Dora are something I hope to add later, although there are few other things I want to implement first. :)

content: Had a blast with it so far really enjoy the profiles for the opponents

Cute furries! The voice acting is a nice touch. And the tutorials and hints are top-notch, a great app for anyone wanting to learn to play Riichi with friends. Plus, no ads? It's a dream come true. This is a perfect app.
Good tutorial, great for beginners
The nicest mobile riichi client out there with a super dedicated developer, highly recommended!
Very good app, no problems playing so far! Worth the $ in my opinion. Wish there was an option for multiplayer (that would be awesome!)

As a recent convert to the mahjong lifestyle, i have found this is the best app on android for practicing offline, and the best designed mahjong game on Android period. For mid to beginner skill the Ai is quite competent, but i would like to see higher level opponents appear as well. I would buy a feature rich sequel to Kemono Mahjong day one, or support a Patreon for continued development. Well done Cyber Dog.
cant wait til multiplayer
Great way to learn the game, all the Yaku and other terms seemed staggering at first but this breaks it down very simply
Worth the money for a great jap mahjong app
The best Riichi Mahjong game I've played on a phone. The layout is unique and works perfectly. also, the art and multiple characters' styles of play are good. There's even a no-numbers tileset.

Great interface and singleplayer. The guide + yaku list make the game very accessible. Please implement multiplayer if possible! I try to play against bots as if I'm on a timer (as online mahjong should be), but their ability to play their turn instantly adds considerable pressure.
replyContent: Thanks for playing! Glad you enjoy. And, yes, I'm working on implementing multiplayer. No ETA yet, but it's getting closer. :)  Follow me on Twitter for updates. (@kemonomahjong).

content: Best Mahjong game available on Android and iOS. Teaches actual competitive Riichi Japanese Mahjong.
amaze
This is a very nice app to learn how to play mahjong. I am a newbie and already manage to unterstand the basics. The price is fair for what it offer.

Kemono Mahjong is excellent for learning Riichi mahjong. it doesn't help you out much, so you mostly learn by experience. The AI is pretty good and diverse in playstyles. The stats are useful, too. The game has run flawlessly since I got it in 2018. No crashes or bugs as far as I can tell. Wholeheartedly recommended!
Taught me how to play Mahjong so I could finally beat it in Yakuza. All I needed.

If there's one thing I think a mahjong app needs these days, it's an option for online multiplayer. Unfortunately, while this app is fun, and the AI is generally well done for a mahjong game, the lack of such a functionality hurts its value as anything more than a convenient practice tool when you have nothing better to do.
fabulous 👍

I'm new to mahjong and this is a great way to get practice. The tutorials are great, they explain the rules and basic strategies clearly without being long. The UI is simple and easy to use, and the gameplay itself is smooth. I don't know how good the AI is for experienced players, but for someone like me this app is perfect.
Very fun way to learn Mahjong! there's a guide so you don't have to worry about remember all the hands at first. All of the characters are very cute and even voiced! love this app!
Very good introduction to the game.  Can we expect more content updates for this in the future?
replyContent:
Thanks, I'm glad you like!
And, yes, there are a bunch of things I'd like to add, some already in the works. :) I'm working on adding multiplayer. Follow me on Twitter for updates. :)

content: I went from being totally confused by Riichi Mahjong to feeling like I could probably play against real people comfortably. The aesthetic is pleasant, the tutorial is EXTEREMLY helpful... 10/10 I'd recommend paying for it, it's worth it.

Only east and south wind rounds?! Why can't we have the option to play the full 4 winds? As someone used to play hong kong with my family I wanted to learn the riichi version but I can't help but feel that the game is too short.
replyContent: It is typical in Japanese mahjong to only play the East and South rounds (a "hanchan")... so, yes, the match can be shorter, but the strategic elements do change the gameplay dynamics. Thank you for playing.

content: Great japanese rules mahjong game, can you add 3-player mode on the next update please ?

It is honestly the best riichi mahjong available on Google Play. With no ads, no lootcrate mechanics, plenty of help and tutorials, the price tag is very much worth it if your interested in learning riichi.
crushed a few times on pixel 3. fix it and i will change to 5 stars
The best english riichi mahjong app i've found. Good tutorials instead of just vomiting rules at you.
Love this app. First one I've found that actually helps you learn to play. Enjoying very much!

Great to provide some guidance to the rules to a newcomer like me, still needs more instructions on how to avoid furiten and more tips on strategy, how to get yaku. Good practice with virtual opponents.
having the reference book at any time is great. hopefully multiplayer comes out. I'm a new player so I can't comment on the AIs.

They're aren't too many mahjong apps on here that are the actual competitive game and few of those seem to have full English language support. This is a great way to get started playing real riichi mahjong!
Amazing introduction to Japanese Maj Jong.
I love this app. Best Mahjong app in English i have found. Easy game play and tutorials. The only thing is i wish there was a way to play against other players.
Absolutely wonderful app, has the best tutorial I've seen for riichi apps on here
worth every penny. lets me waste my time everywhere. tsumo/10
As a complete beginner at Mahjong, this game was perfect! The tutorials explained everything very clearly :)
Taught me how to play Riichi mahjong better than any other game or resource I've found so far. highly recommended
A learning experience.

Excellent mobile version of Riichi Mahjong. The unique vertical format works beautifully on a phone and makes for quick games you can jump into. Currently no multiplayer but the dev appears to be working on it and I look forward to hopefully playing against both human and AI players. If you have never played, the tutorials help to guide you through the basics if the game and explain many of the less-obvious rules. If you enjoy Riichi Mahjong, this is a solid way to play a solo game any time.

fantastic game! its very fun and does an excellent job teaching you how to play! it also looks great and has nice music. only improvements i can think of would be to add an animation of the player declareing ron, richi, etc. just throw some text up on screen or something. maybe something similar to an ace attorney "Objection!" or the wii sports "strike". more music and mahjong tile skins would be cool too. (you CAN unlock things but idk what it is. havent filled the next unlock bar yet.)
Great mahjong app...very fun and dynamic and the characters are funny!
Fantastic game. A+
Deliciously fun game!

My favorite mahjong app! It teaches the rules very well, and it allows some adjustments (HK or JPN). Overall, my game has been massively improved, and now I have a good chunk of the yaku memorized. Would recommend to anyone who likes mahjong. Also, cuddly cute guys are a plus.
So smooth!
Clear, plain English instructions. The art and voices are cute. The system for selecting a discard tile is very friendly to those of us with chubby fingers.
Possibly the best mahjong game on all existence.
replyContent: Much appreciated. I hope you'll enjoy what I have planned for future updates! :)

content: fun, addictive app that is just what it's advertised. Too few apps these days are like that

Great game with really good tutorials. Was able to quickly adapt my knowledge of the Chinese style of play and felt comfortable after going through some of the tutorials and a full game. Well done. Plays well on my Galaxy Tab A from a few years ago.
replyContent: Thank you, glad you enjoy! More updates in the works. :)

content: Could not be better. There is not a better, easier to use, and play Mahjong game. The tutorial and ability to look up hands really brings it to the next level. I never fully comprehended the rules until i got this app.
replyContent: Thank you so much! I hope you'll enjoy future updates I'm working on! :)

content: Good tutorial, nice sense of progression and really great sound design. Well worth it :)
Sometimes closes when selecting ron, pung, etc.

This is a great app for playing mahjong on your own. The different characters and all their art and voice lines are a nice component. The regular updates are great too. I play this basically every day while commuting; definitely worth it!
Buff lizards are also nice.
good learning tool

The only full featured Riichi style Mahjong app out there in english, that alone earns 5 stars. My only wish is being able to swap out the avitars for others, I am not a fan of the anthropomorphic art style but to each their own.
Excellent app. I would recomend for new or advanced players alike. Five stars from me, developer deserve it.

This app is fantastic. One of the few Mahjong apps I've found that's available fully in English. It also includes some help on how to play, which can be useful if you're unused to the game. Plus it has cute anthropomorphic animals! What's not to love?
Great for beginners. I love the option to change the terms. Ron!
A fantastic, colorful implementation of the game with excellent tutorials. Also one of the most stable apps I've ever used. Well done
Actual riichi mahjong, with good explanations for beginners and a very handy yaku listing that is good for everyone.
Superb intro to Riichi Mahjong with memorable characters. Good for teaching you the rules. seems to be regularly evolving and undergoing active development.

If you're looking to learn how to play Japanese Mahjong, this is a great app to invest in. The tutorial explains the game pretty clearly and quickly to get you playing. The solo play is pretty good as well. I dont feel it is to difficult for people that are learning. A big thumbs up to the developer.

This is an excellent Riichi Mahjong game, especially if you can get used to the unorthodox presentation. The only things I'd like added are an option for Aka dora (red dora) and a way to highlight discarded copies of tiles (e.g. If I could see if anyone has discarded a Green Dragon yet by touching a Green Dragon in my hand, that'd be wonderful. Mahjong World 2 does this.) Edit: Ty for the quick reply! One last thing is that the tiles look very small, so an option for large tiles would be great.
replyContent:
Thanks, glad you enjoy! I was planning to add Red Dora in a future update… will try to work in highlighting discards too.
Tile size… on tall (HD+) screens, players will get larger tiles, but on other screens, there was only so much I could do. However, you might find the "Simplified" or "Traditional (2)" tile set easier to read. Hope that helps. :)

content: I've played numerous Mahjong games that claim to have tutorials, plus watched "how to play" videos, but this game explained the game far more clearly than anything else I've tried. I now can play with actual strategy, and feel confident in the moves I'm making. Excellent game, and if you're really interested in learning to play, well worth the price. Online or pass and play would be an excellent addition though.
replyContent: Thanks, I'm glad you're enjoying it! More features are in the works. :) (Look me up on Twitter for updates)

content: I'm loving the cheat-sheet button in the upper right! I still have trouble remembering all the hand types!
professionally made with decent tutorial
This app is really good. It's only ¥400. Please buy it. 5☆ このアプリはとても良いです。４００円ばかりです。買ってください。５☆
replyContent: ありがとうございます！もっとアップデートが来ています！

content: Fantastic lessons on Japanese mahjong, recently added to Final Fantasy 14. Helpful visual diagrams for concepts.

I'm new to Mahjong so I was worried about how complex the game is especially all the Yaku.. but the tutorials have been helping a ton! And being able to reference the Yaku mid game is awesome for new players. Love the app! Worth it if you really want to learn the game.
It's a great introduction to the game. the tutorial is a bit dense but it was you through the most important parts of the game. is what i imagine, as a beginner.
One of the best if not the best Riichi Mahjong apps available in English. Dont let the furry characters dissuade you. Looking forward to that multiplayer mode!
A good way to familiarise yourself with riichi mahjong ♥️
Learning riichi mahjong this app has been a great tool, I'm still a noob but getting better :) well designed and fun opponents

Thank you so much for this excellent game. It's taught me how to play Riichi Mahjong. The characters individual play styles are a brilliant way to learn new tactics and challenge yourself against specific styles. Probably the best solo Mahjong game on mobile.
One of my favorite games u wu.

Always wanted to learn to play Mahjong and this app has been very helpful. For a beginner who is using this app to learn to play it's been very clear. I like that the tutorial being segmented as it helped the flow and am enjoying that the fan guide is always available. I am also really liking the art and the music as they create a much better atmosphere compared to a game with no music and just voiceless names as opponents. Overall would very much recommend this to beginners learning to play.
Best Japanese Mahjong game on android, hands down. Can't wait to see what updates are next!

I love this game! Very good at teaching (taught me in more or less three mstches). My only gripe is the AI which I quickly found myself outmatching. I would suggest they handle honour tiles a little more carefully, particularly Dora tiles which have been fairly easy to consistently gather up.
replyContent: Thanks for playing, and I'm glad it's helped you learn! There are multiple characters with different play styles, some which you may yet have to unlock. Perhaps some of them will provide a stronger challenge? But, adjusting the AI is an ongoing process. ;)

content: Kemono Mahjong is probably the best Riichi Mahjong app available for Android. The tutorials are great for beginners, and UI is condensed and perfect for phones, and lots of settings to choose from. Also there are cute beast men too that all have different playstyles. Great portable Mahjong app!
grear game for learning mahjong. hope u guys add more mahjong styles(hongkong,singapore) in the future
The best single riichi mahjong games, hope for the online multiplayer features
Subarashi!

I know it seems daunting to dive in when you see a 4.99 price tag, but if you're looking to jump into Riichi mahjong and want to practice while you wait to play in real life, this is the most well made mobile app I've used to date. The tutorials have game-level hands on learning, the art and characters are full of life rather than staring a green table for hours. The user interface for a vertical layout is extrenely intuitive and easy to learn. Please give this a chance. It's more than worth it!
replyContent:
Thank you so much! :)
I hope you'll enjoy the updates I'm working on, too!

content: Very user-friendly game, with nice ambiance. Trying to learn in order to play in FFXIV, but adversaries are destroying me ^ω^° Would need a little bigger font in tutorial, it's too small.
well made and fun to play.

This game has done so much to help me learn the rules of riichi mahjong AND has super cute designs! I'm intrigued by the different AI opponent options and look forward to experimenting with those as my own strategy develops. Woo!

Good game! Nice tutorial, but it's skippable if you already know the rules. Love that you can change to japanese calls, and switch between different tilesets. Occasional issues on the pixel 2xl hitting the call buttons on bottom right, but overall, very good game!
Thanks so much for this. Hard to find good software for japanese mahjong, but you nailed it. Well worth being a paid app
One of the few Richii Mahjong apps on the market and a great tutorial. Great tool to get into FFXIV's Doman Mahjong as well.

Great game. Way more helpful in explaining then any other mahjong game so far. wish they had voice explanation while playing as if you are playing with friends and they are explaining while you play so I don't have to keep looking down to reed.
great game this stuff is really hard to learn though

Hello from Final Fantasy 14! Thanks for developing this game and the tutorial option. There are so many rules and situations a player can get into. So providing a comprehensive tutorial, walking a player through the rules and having explanations for Furiten, dora and riichi all help. And these AI players are as cunning as some of the people I've played against since Doman Mahjong went live in game. Keep up the great work!
replyContent:
Thank you for playing! I made the game partly in hopes of giving people an easier introduction to Japanese-style mahjong, so I'm glad you've found it useful! :)
More updates planned...

content: I've never played mahjong but now I feel like a pro!
Loving the app, fun way to learn riichi mahjong! Option to turn of the small western numbers would help in learning the symbols. Can't really thing of anything else, great app!
replyContent:
Hi, thank you - glad you're enjoying the game!
Re: the numerals, you can choose the "Traditional (2)" tile-set from the Settings menu for tiles without them. Hope that helps! :)

content: one of the best English mahjong games available, explains the rules well enough, and is well worth the price you pay.

I have wanted to learn Mahjong for a while and this game is great for teaching it. The characters add a really nice flair too. Consider adding some more - like a monkey from Brazil or a boar from Germany or something
replyContent: Thanks, glad you're enjoying it! I have an update in the works that adds some more characters! :)

content: I've always wanted to learn how to play the proper mahjong, not the solitaire one. This one does it with the assistance of cute animals. I have only won 1 hand so far but I look forward to practicing more!
Serves as a friendly introduction to the daunting game of Riichi Mahjong. Very well-made game! Fun art and good soundwork. Keep up the good work!
replyContent: Thank you! I hope you'll enjoy future updates!

content: Good but it would help to be able to see what the symbol tiles mean when in game (they differ from the one I'm used to). It would also help if I didn't suck :'{
replyContent: Thanks for playing! There are three different tile sets available; swapping briefly to the "Simplified" set mid-game might be of help? And, good luck - practice helps! :)

content: great game, well made version of 4 player mahjong, but i can never seem to win a single hand.
replyContent: Thank you for playing! The AI can be challenging; you might find Khan and Flint slightly weaker opponents. Osamu can also be a bit hobbled if you play with "All Simples" set to be for closed hands only. Good luck! (I have trouble against the AI myself sometimes!)

content: Thank you for making a mahjong game like this that's easy to dive in to! you made it easy to pick up, you should totally make a hanafuda game with the same art style ;D always wanted to learn that game more too.
if you havent played majong this is a good place to start
This give me a lot of inspirations! Thanks for the game.
10 / 10 great game, beautiful GUI and just lovely all arround. Unfortunately its SFW, still a good game tho
Perfect introduction riichi game, worth every penny!
great introductions to rules. fun characters and tone.

so far it's explained all the rules excellently, I only wish the tutorial for understanding yaku rules showed examples of how to figure out what you have during a game, and what to aim for during play.
This game is just so relaxing. Pressure-free way to learn coupled with grease visuals.
Great beginners tool for getting in tons of practice.
So addictive!!!!
Great game to learn riichi mahjong! I like the theme (it adds a little flair which helps the learning experience). The tutorials are also super helpful.
Brilliant app! Looks, sounds and plays amazing with a lot of in depth help on rules and scoring. Would definitely recommend!
replyContent: Thank you so much, I'm glad you're enjoying it. More updates planned. :)

content: Awesome game. Should feature a Naga (snake with arms) player. OuO Otherwise, awesome!!!
replyContent: It's tough to try to cater to every type of animals' fans. ;) But I'm glad you enjoy the game, and I will keep your request in mind for future updates. Thanks for playing!

content: To me so far it has been a good way to learn mah jong without pressure of a clock.
Best Mahjong app around.
An amazing app for beginners(like me), and one of the very few Riichi games in the store in English. Despite lacking a speedup option and being a battery hog, this is a great one!
Need some feminine characters :)
replyContent: Thanks for playing! v1.07 introduces some female characters to the cast! :)

content: So well made and relaxing, and I'm learning a lot about mahjong at the same time!
Good presentation and usability. Quite good tutorial on mahjong. Characters are a nice touch. I wish it was able to offer optional advice during normal gameplay to speed up learning.
A truly fantastic Mahjong game with great graphics and interesting AI opponents with different personalities.

It is difficult to create a software program that emulates a tabletop game with multiple surrogate (AI) opponents. Even the more so, doing this for a game with so many detailed special cases as any variant of mahjong must be nearly impossible. Despite that, this version of Japanese Riichi Mahjong does the job admirably, is playable and entertaining, and even has a selection of furry faced opponents with individual playing patterns and clever artwork. Prompts and occasional hints help the beginner along. Excellent job.
Great game design . Easy to use interface. Great beginner app for novices
4€ well spent
Only thing that would make this game perfect is multiplayer. Everything else is gorgeous and works fantastically.
The game is pretty easy to get into but tricky to fully understand. Nevertheless, this game covered the basics really well and offers nice music with cute character design. I love it!
The best tutorials and explanations I've yet seen for Riichi Mahjong in the west. Also cute characters.
Probably the best mahjong available in the playstore right now... Tried like 4 others and this is best one

Not much more to say than great. The tutorials arent overly long, and tell you good information with some flavor text. The devs respond quickly if you contact them (contacted them on twitter to ask a question, they responded same day) and are very professional. Im only a beginner.. but this app is worth the money.

The characters/character art and animations are really fun and provides a nice alternative to a more generic felt-table backdrop I've seen in other options.  Would be nice if tiles could be a bit bigger? But there's a lot to fit on the screen, so maybe this is best. Also wanted to second the request for female NPCs, too!
replyContent:
Thank you!
v1.06.60 should now give users with taller screens (like the Pixel 2 XL) a layout that has larger tiles - I hope you like it!
Some female characters are also in the works. :)
Glad you're enjoying the game.

content: Best Mahjong app for Riichi. Too bad it's pay and made furry, but it's the best bar none.
One of the best Mahjong game. I try to play Mahjong a few time, but this is the first app that really help me learn how to play and also have fun wile learning.

I still have a lot to learn, but I'm picking it up pretty quick. Definitely a good tool for teaching mahjong. Also, Osamu does an Undertale reference if the wall gets exhausted, so that's neat. Edit: NEW CHARACTERS?! FANTASTIC!!
replyContent: Thanks - I'm glad you're enjoying it! :)

content: Well, it's pretty much the best mahjong app on android. Tutorial is very good with some examples of in-game situations. Graphics is very pleasant.

super polished, western friendly REAL mahjong game with a great tutorial and production values. clearly a labor of love and fairly priced. hard to get a decent game of mahjong with smooth Gameplay and graphics these days outside of asia
replyContent: Thank you so much! I hope you'll enjoy future updates! :)

content: Easy to play! Even if you don't know Mahjong the optional tutorials make it easy to understand.
A great rendition of the traditional japanese game. A true gem well worth it's price.
Love this game. It has a very good tutorial. Addicting game play. Great characters that are so cute!
I can't stop playing it!
Very entertaining rendition of riichi style mahjong.

Very good for a beginner trying to learn the game. It has good explanations for all the yakus and even tells you which ones your opponents are doing. Very helpful and probably the best richii app on the playstore.
Great tutorial and game play. Easily my favorite mahjong app.

I absolutely love this game. I got into riichi style mahjong after playing 
Yakuza, but that game did not explain the intricacies of mahjong well. This 
game, however, does that! The presentation is excellent: from the character 
design to the voice acting and music. These touches make this Mahjong app 
game more than your run over the mill mahjong app game. I am a furry so I 
couldn't ask for more with this Mahjong app game. One critique I have is I 
wish the probability of drawing and creating high scoring hands was better. 
PS: I hope there are more unlockables in future versions of the game.

Incredibly good way to learn to play the full game with helpful hints and 
tips
Fun and cute!

A solid riichi app with a good tutorial. It takes a bit to get used to the 
discards not being in a 6*3 grid, but it's perfect for practising on the 
go. You can choose to use simplified or traditional tiles, and set various 
things such as open tanyao and match length. Note that there is no oka or 
uma.
replyContent: (Hi Alex; v1.06.21 now includes a way of distinguishing between discards from the hand or just-drawn-tile. Thanks again!)

content: Really good app! But it really feels like AI sees your hand :(
replyContent:
Thank you, I'm glad you enjoy it. :)
I know you just have my word for it, but - no, the CPU doesn't "cheat"… it can't see your tiles. I did try to add some code for when it detects someone is close to a win, though (eg. on Riichi)… it'll be more likely to discard 'safer' tiles (eg. ones that player has discarded).
'hope you'll enjoy future updates.

content:
The optional yaku breakdown after every hand is brilliant. Best Mahjong app 
in the store. These furries are extremely good though and very lucky.
Game is very tight and polished. Heavily reccomend.

Best Mahjong app out there. No adware, great graphics, very helpful 
tutorials.

A well-designed, true Mahjong game app that teaches the rules for the 
riichi variant of the game. No multiplayer mode (AI only), but a fun way to 
learn how to play and pass the time all the same!

Pawsome indeed, proper Riichi Mahjong game, and with furries. The UI works 
well with phone-type devices, too.
A good way to practice for beginners
Great game, even for novices!
The best way to learn riichi mahjong out there, honestly.

While i wish the game displayed the tiles on a table with walls built, but 
never the less, its one of the best riichi mahjong game on android.

Worth the price of admission. I'm still a riichi mahjong novice, but the core gameplay is polished and graphics are top notch. The UI is well done for a mobile phone. Hope to see more characters in the future and maybe a character selection option? Would like to play as green dragon mahjong dude or mahjong wolf bro. Also, an option to speed up the game would be appreciated. Any plans for multiplayer as well?
replyContent:
Thank you!
Some new characters are coming soon; going to look at speed optimizations after. Multiplayer is going to be tricky, but is a long-term hope (w/ a character select to represent your player). :)

content: Best app for riichi mahjong
Good for learning riichi mahjong
I love playing mahjong, riichi rules can be challenging but fun experience

Love this, it's exactly what I was looking for in a Riichi Mahjong app. Just wondering though, are there plans to add red tiles as an option in the future? It would be great to have the option to play with another possible source of Han.
replyContent:
Thanks, glad you enjoy it!
I hope to add Red 5s in future; I have a few other things I'm working on first, though. :)

content: Best way to interactively learn Mahjong. +1 for not being full of gratuitous anime chic's ;3
Possibly the most beginner-friendly Riichi Mahjong app out there. Totally worth the money.
Fantastic mahjong gameplay in a great looking package!
Has a lot of information for a beginner. Great resource and a good way for practice against the computer. Plus, the characters are really cute.
Very cute. Great mahjong with a lot of nice features
Awwesomely well made game and great for learning mahjong
Cool game with good tuto
Gud
It's a good time killer. This game is worth it!
Great riichi mahjong game that westerners can learn and enjoy
Great explanation of game mechanics, tough but fun.
Very fun game game with nice art and a very helpful tutorial. Great for learning, no matter how long it takes.
best mahjong game
It's wonderful for beginners to learn how to play!
This is *the* mobile traditional Mahjong game for me. Great tutorializing and interface, and runs super smoothly. Great work!

Really portable mahjong app with cute kemono guys, too. Dev is really responsive to questions and updates the app on a frequent basis. Not enough Japanese Mahjong apps exist, but this one really delivers an easy to understand HUB, tiles that can change for what you're used to reading, and a progress tracker to commemorate your high scores and rare hands.
It's the Dark Souls of Mahjong.
Best mahjong app ever!
This app was incredibly helpful. I've only just started playing, but it's really helped me in understanding how the game works.

Just started playing mahjong, thanks to Yakuza 0. This game does a much better job of teaching. The tutorials are really helpful, the characters are extremely cute, and overall the game is very welcoming.

It's awesome, def one of the best Mahjong apps for beginners. Just wish the selected tile for discard would highlight similar tiles discarded by other players. Also, I wish I could select the furries I play against... That friggin dragon keeps destroying every game.
replyContent:
Thank you! I'm glad you're enjoying it!

Interesting idea about highlighting matching discarded tiles… I'll consider working that in to a future build.

And, yeah, I will be adding an opponent-select screen in future, as I hope to add some new characters with other play styles.

Thanks for your support!

content: Great game, nice art style, really fun.
Best mahjong out there. Really helps you learn to play and score ^^   Hoping to choose your character later on because it seems that you don't get to choose, but it's not a big issue.

This is a great introduction to riichi mahjong! Whenever the rules started to feel too abstract, I just started playing (and losing) games, and now I feel like I'm really getting the hang of it. And it helps to have such cute opponents!
This is the highest quality majong app out there now. If you don't mind the antromophic characters, buy now.
replyContent: Thank you so much! :)  I hope you'll enjoy future updates I'm planning.

content: Well done introduction for me into the world of mahjong

This is the first Mahjong game I'd purchased for Android and I love it. It's really good fun. The tutorials were also really good for learning the game and improving. The AI is good and will sometimes take you by surprise.
Great game for a beginner. I knew nothing about riichi mahjong before playing this but just after finishing the tutorial I feel like I understand all of the basics.
replyContent: Thank you so much! I hope you will enjoy the updates I have planned. :)

content: Thanks for teaching me! Along with nice graphics and a warm and friendly competition, the game also has a great guide.
Great little mahjong game with an amusing theme, and a lot of solid options.
This is the mahjong game I've been waiting for. This is perfect for beginners. Some hand holding sure but this will last for a while.

There's a quintillion mahjong programs out there but out of the ones that don't expect you know how to play even those usually keep instructions to a manual or in-game tutorial. You can actually get GOOD at mahjong through this game. Also it's adorbs.
replyContent: Thank you, I'm glad you enjoy it! :)

content: I finally understand how to play mahjong thanks to this game.

It's a really fun game even though I'm bad at it. Sometimes I can't claim a tile that would let me win, or my hand appears to be a winning hand but I'm forced to discard anyways. I'm sure it's because there's some rule that I don't realize that's preventing me from winning, but I don't understand what it is. Also, I am experiencing an issue where upon a round ending the characters will sometime be replaced by other characters mid-game. It is very strange but not game-breaking.
replyContent:
Thanks, I'm glad you're enjoying it! :)
Concerning not being able to declare a win - review the "Yaku" and "Furiten" tutorials again. The characters changing mid-game... I've not noticed that, but I will certainly investigate!
Thanks again!

content: Very cute and accurate to the gameplay I love.
There was a great job done on this, do love burning off downtime with these handy little tiles. I know I can get better too. Worth the sum of money and more.

There seems to be an issue with the scoring. I had self drawn a hand which with a concealed kong. There ought to be 3 concealed pungs in the  hand, but that yaku was not accounted for. Would appreciate if this bug could be fixed.
replyContent: My apologies for the problem. v1.03.18 - rolling out now - fixes it now. Thanks for letting me know. :)

content: Great artstyle, smooth gameplay, very well designed overall and a worthwhile purchase for any mahjong fan!
If you have never played mahjong, this game is a great teaching tool. The AI is simple but the game has the features to help you sort out how to play and interpret riichi mahjong. Worth it!
It's a fun and cute game. Really good for learning how to play mahjong
Great app for Riichi Mahjong, exactly what I needed. And the AI is better than other apps I've tried, highly recommended.
replyContent: Thank you so much! :)

content: I'm an experienced mahjong player and was looking for an app that I could recommend to my friends to help them practice. The fact that this app has a solid tutorial and a list of yaku that can be pulled up during games makes this perfect for players who are still learning the game. The score breakdown at the end of each hand is clear and should help less experienced players practice scoring hands.  I have enjoyed this app very much and have already recommended it to my friends. This game gets better and better with each update, and I'm looking forward to more in the future.
replyContent:
Thanks! The update that just came out has the Japanese terms (pon, kan, chi) applied to the Yaku descriptions and the tutorials too, if that setting is enabled, along with the Japanese names of the yaku displayed. :)

Glad you like the game!

content: Nice and relaxing
This is a cute a fun game. I picked up on it right away. I have issues occassionally choosing the wrong tiles, but that might be more my fingers and less this app.
replyContent: Thanks, I'm glad you like! I'll be adjusting things & adding new features… I appreciate the support. :)

content: Love the graphics! Very good gameplay and function. Only quibble I've got is that you should be able to declare kan while in riichi if it doesn't affect your wait.
replyContent:
Thank you! You should be given the option to declare a concealed Kan while in Riichi if it doesn't change your wait… maybe send me a screenshot of you find an instance where this doesn't happen?

Glad you like the game, and thank you for your support! I hope you'll enjoy the updates I have planned!

content: If you're interested in riichi style mahjong, it's hard to go wrong with this! Cute characters help too. If I could advise improvements, would like to see when you use Japanese terms (chi, kan, pon) it would replace the (chow, kong, pung) in the various yaku listings and such - right now, they only affect the in game calls. Still, two thumbs up!
replyContent: Thank you! The recent update now has the yaku definitions & tutorials use the Japanese terms if that setting is enabled. Lots of things I'm hoping to add in future too - thanks for the support! :)

content: This is a great game for anyone trying to get into the game of mahjong. The tutorials are well written and the character art is done so well it feels more like a visual nicer than a basic explication. The breakdown of scoring at the end of a round is incredibly helpful too so that you can learn from rounds as they go by.  I don't know if the AI will offer challenges to intermediate or advanced players since there seems to be no setting for that at this time, but I haven't won yet :p  The app has room to grow and become even better, but this might be one of the most polished indie 1.0 releases I've gotten my hands on.  It is absolutely worth the price of admission to learn how to play in a solid and aesthetically pleasing package!
replyContent: Thank you so much for the kind words! I certainly hope to expand the difficulty options and AI over time, plus add new features too. :)  Glad you liked the tutorials!

content: I previously had complaints, but a recent update has addressed them. By far functionally the best mahjong app available.  I can easily ignore my dislike for the Furry aesthetic with how consistently wonderful the playability is.
replyContent: Thanks so much! I hope you'll enjoy the updates I have planned, too. :)

content: Great Mahjong app with smooth interface and enjoyable gameplay. Great for honing your strategy without time pressure from real players.

Fantastic Japanese mahjong app. Runs very smoothly and with a clean and sleek interface. Lots of personality although a bit cheesy. Proper tutorials and guides. Would suggest adding variations for rules such as Chinese rules. Best mahjong app for an English speaking audience
Decidedly solid implementation of Mahjongg
It'll be alright

The flat-out best English language riichi-style mahjong game!  You can always access a list of yaku (scoring conditions necessary to win a hand), and all the yaku in a winnijg hand are underlined and tappable. This makes learning the yaku easy and intuitive. Tutorials are as brief as possible and well-written.   I'd recommend this app to EVERYONE--beginners and seasoned players alike.  If you watched Akagi, Saki, or other mahjong anime, this is the best way to start playing.
replyContent: Thank you! I'm glad you enjoy it, and I hope you'll like the updates I have planned. :)

content: Without a doubt the best game to introduce beginners to the world of riichi mahjong

Love the UI being stacked rather than trying to cram a mahjong table onto my little screen. Love the art, tutorials, and in-game reference page. I'd prefer the buttons to be further from my tiles though. Occasionally, I'll hit discard on accident when selecting a tile. Likewise, the ignore button is in the same place as the discard button, so I've once tapped ignore, didn't know if it registered, tried to tap it again, but it became the discard button when it came back to my turn, causing me to discard a tile on accident. A bug I run into often is after a game ends, the button to go back seems to be hidden so all I see is the board with no option to exit. Another bug I found after installing was going through the yaku tutorial, then starting a new game, the board was empty and no tiles would deal. I wasn't able to reproduce it afterwards so maybe it only occurs after installation (Nexus 5X Android 7.1.2). In the future I wish for more features like a campaign/tournament mode, varying ai difficulties, faster speed gameplay, and auto riichi discarding. At the moment, I think the only things better than Maujong are the art, UI idea, and tutorials/reference. That said, I enjoy the game and hope it succeeds!   Something I'm curious about is the decision to order the players so the turns go from bottom to top rather than top to bottom. Starting the game, I assumed it would be top to bottom, but maybe you have a good reason?
replyContent:
Hi Raymond - thx for the feedback!
I'm working on a fix for the "blank board after a tutorial" issue... sorry for the problem!
I hope to add more & varied AI routines in time & will see what I can do re: button placement, along with other features/additions (inc. those you mention here). As to bottom-to-top… 'just thought it flowed nicer.
Thanks!

content: Solid mahjong game that's very approachable for beginners. The tutorials are much appreciated, and the interface is snappy and easy-to-use. My only suggestion is that an indicator for when the player is furiten could be nice, especially for beginners like myself.
replyContent: Thanks for the input! The recent update adds a "Furiten indicator" you can enable in the settings. :)

content: A great way to learn how to play Japanese Mahjong, tutorials are great and the AI seems really well coded.
Been waiting for this to come out for s while, and I'm delighted with it so far! Thanks for making me wanna learn mahjong!
Great app all around, has really taught me to play and now when playing with friends in real life I can sometimes beat them
Great tutorial for beginners to the game,  and adorable characters to boot!
This is great! I've never played anything online remotely close to this and it's super cute.
